title: A’ Design Awards And Competition – The Winners
description: A’ Design Award & Competition is the Worlds’ leading design accolade reaching design enthusiasts in over 115 countries.
author: Erin
excerpt: A’ Design Award & Competition is the Worlds’ leading design accolade reaching design enthusiasts in over 115 countries.
text: contemporist has partnered with A’ Design Award and Competition to bring you this editorial feature A’ Design Award & Competition is the Worlds’ leading design accolade reaching design enthusiasts in over 115 countries. The Laureates of the A’ Design Award & Competition get fame, prestige, recognition, credibility, publicity and international awareness, in addition to a comprehensive and extensive winners’ kit. You will also receive a Gala Night invitation, be included in the yearbook, be promoted to media partners, receive an award trophy, receive feedback notes by the Jury, a Proof of Creation Document, inclusion in the world design rankings, a free sales listing at SaloneDelDesigner, and translation of award-winning works for international press. Find out all the prize details, here. If you are interested in registering for next year’s award, you can do so, here. And you can learn more about the awards, here. For the 2024 – 2025 design competition, there were 1823 Winners from 115 countries in 157 different design disciplines. Let’s have a look at a selection of the winners… Genipabu Buffet by Estudio Galho The Genipabu Sideboard/Buffer is inspired by the stunning Genipabu Dunes, where the wind sculpts the sands into enchanting landscapes. Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Furniture Design Category – find out more here. Image by Estudio Galho Fuma House by Masakatsu Matsuyama A three-story home designed with a reinforced concrete structure, which allows the homeowner to live in an open, unusual and tranquil atmosphere. Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Architecture, Building and Structure Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Toshihisa Ishii Breath Of The Glacier Sustainable Fashion Cloth by Yibo Ji Inspired by the melting and formation cycles of glaciers, this collection symbolizes their breathing life-force. The collection is entirely made from biodegradable polyester fiber synthetic leather and faux fur. The fabric is crafted with materials that mimic the intricate textures of melting glacier surfaces, with the patterns being manually pieced together to replicate the glacier’s unique forms Silver A’ Design Award Winner for Fashion, Apparel and Garment Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Yibo Ji Valencia House by Lucas Padovani Located in the countryside of São Paulo, Valencia House is a carefully designed summer retreat aimed at bringing the family together amidst the tranquility of the countryside. Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Architecture, Building and Structure Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Fran Parente Al Ghunayman Villa Architecture by Islam Farrag This ultra-modern villa with its fluid architecture, seamlessly integrates with nature, featuring expansive glass walls and minimalist interiors, while organic shapes and a subdued color palette evoke a sense of tranquility and sophistication. Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Architecture, Building and Structure Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Islam Farrag Embrasse Moi Lamp Sculpture Lamp by Giuseppe Tortato Embrasse Moi is a piece of art designed with parametric software and handcrafted, maintaining a unique and sinuous design. The inspiration comes from the spirals of DNA and the possibility, through craftsmanship, to bend a difficult material like bronze. Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Lighting Products and Fixtures Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Carola Merello Xingshufu Banouet Restaurant by Haodong Liu The Xingshufu Banouet Restaurant is a high-end dining space that mainly integrates Sichuan cuisine, and features materials like wood veneer, vintage stainless steel, marble, leather, mirrored stainless steel, mosaic, Malay paint, and more. Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Interior Space and Exhibition Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Haha Lu Huai’an Zhongshuge Bookstore by Li Xiang The design of Huai’an Zhongshuge draws inspiration from the local urban culture, the theme of human exploration of the universe, and the symbolic significance of books. Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Interior Space and Exhibition Design Category – find out more here. Photography by SFAP Chicago Line Armchair by Alexandre Kasper The “Chicago” collection is inspired by the essence of modern and industrial architecture that defines the city of Chicago, in the United States. Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Furniture Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Alexandre Kasper Snow Park Exhibition Center by Kris Lin The inspiration for this project comes from a documentary about a Chinese explorer’s glacier expedition. The exhibition hall features a fluid circulation design and multi-sensory interactive installations that seamlessly immerse visitors. Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Interior Space and Exhibition Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Kris Lin International Design Mystical Serpent Light Art Installation by PHAIdesign The inspiration of “Mystical Serpent” comes from the legend of Zhulong, a serpent deity from ancient Chinese lore who governs day-night cycles and symbolizes eternal life. Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Fine Arts and Art Installation Design Category – find out more here. Photography by DXIN Spiral Bloom Public Art by Kuo Kuo-Hsiang The artwork Spiral Bloom is inspired by the dynamic energy of life and the infinite possibilities of the future. The design draws from natural forms in motion, such as the spiraling patterns found in biological growth, celestial bodies, and fluid dynamics. Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Fine Arts and Art Installation Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Kuo Kuo-Hsiang Hug Me Sitting by Zipeng Zhou The naturally extending arm design, inspired by a warm embrace, carries two layers of meaning: It imbues the “hug me” with deep affection and the warmth of love. Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Furniture Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Zipeng Zhou Trustlucent Connected Dining Table by Sadra Boushehri Design Studio The journey of this dining table began with a client’s request not to cover the window with furniture. Light moves freely beneath it, creating an airy feel, while the soft oak veneer is warm to the touch, and the nearly invisible base enhances the floating illusion. Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Kitchen Furniture, Equipment and Fixtures Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Sadra Boushehri Design Studio Color Roller Furniture Set by Chuheng He Color Roller is a furniture set that changes color combinations through rolling, using basic shapes and colors to create a unique spatial experience. Made from transparent acrylic, it displays varied colors under different lighting. Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Furniture Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Chuheng He Tresound Mini Desktop Bluetooth Speaker by Yong Cao and Jianfeng Lv With its minimalist appearance and operation, Tresound is a Bluetooth speaker with its mountain shape appearance conforming to the principles of speaker acoustics, with high peaks (high pitched) and thick valleys (mid to low pitched). Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Audio and Sound Equipment Design Category – find out more here. Photography by TRETTITRE AI Vision Sofa by Yunxiang Zou The design of this product draws inspiration from the aesthetic form of AI glasses, boasting not only remarkable advantages in aesthetics but also delivering unique practical value. Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Furniture Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Yunxiang Zou Mia Foldable Cat Bag by Yu Ren FurBallRetreat creates the perfect resting space for your cat! It not only has a beautiful and lovely book-like appearance but also is an essential tool for you and your cat to explore the outdoor world together. Silver A’ Design Award Winner for Pet Care, Toys, Supplies and Products for Animals Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Yu Ren Secret Of Eternity Necklace And Brooch by Esra Erciyes This jewelry piece is inspired by the infinite life cycle of Turritopsis Dohrnii, a species of jellyfish capable of reverting from the adult medusa stage to the polyp stage, making it biologically immortal. The rotating curves symbolize infinite life, while the LED lights represent energy and purity. Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Jewelry Design Category – find out more here. Photography by Company Truva Visual Arts, Art Director /Cüneyt Aslan,Edited / Aysenur Sentürk Lighting Panels Wooden Interior Decoration by Form at Wood The Lighting Panel was inspired by the natural beauty of wood and the atmospheric potential of integrated lighting. Silver A’ Design Award Winner for Luxury Design Category – find out more here. Photography by FORM AT WOOD To be part of the A’ Design Award and Competition, register your designs – here contemporist has partnered with A’ Design Award and Competition to bring you this editorial feature
html:
contemporist has partnered with A’ Design Award and Competition to bring you this editorial feature

A’ Design Award & Competition is the Worlds’ leading design accolade reaching design enthusiasts in over 115 countries.

The Laureates of the A’ Design Award & Competition get fame, prestige, recognition, credibility, publicity and international awareness, in addition to a comprehensive and extensive winners’ kit. You will also receive a Gala Night invitation, be included in the yearbook, be promoted to media partners, receive an award trophy, receive feedback notes by the Jury, a Proof of Creation Document, inclusion in the world design rankings, a free sales listing at SaloneDelDesigner, and translation of award-winning works for international press.

Find out all the prize details, here. If you are interested in registering for next year’s award, you can do so, here. And you can learn more about the awards, here.

For the 2024 – 2025 design competition, there were 1823 Winners from 115 countries in 157 different design disciplines. Let’s have a look at a selection of the winners…

Genipabu Buffet by Estudio Galho

The Genipabu Sideboard/Buffer is inspired by the stunning Genipabu Dunes, where the wind sculpts the sands into enchanting landscapes.

Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Furniture Design Category – find out more here.
Image by Estudio Galho

Fuma House by Masakatsu Matsuyama

A three-story home designed with a reinforced concrete structure, which allows the homeowner to live in an open, unusual and tranquil atmosphere.

Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Architecture, Building and Structure Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Toshihisa Ishii

Breath Of The Glacier Sustainable Fashion Cloth by Yibo Ji

Inspired by the melting and formation cycles of glaciers, this collection symbolizes their breathing life-force. The collection is entirely made from biodegradable polyester fiber synthetic leather and faux fur. The fabric is crafted with materials that mimic the intricate textures of melting glacier surfaces, with the patterns being manually pieced together to replicate the glacier’s unique forms

Silver A’ Design Award Winner for Fashion, Apparel and Garment Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Yibo Ji

Valencia House by Lucas Padovani

Located in the countryside of São Paulo, Valencia House is a carefully designed summer retreat aimed at bringing the family together amidst the tranquility of the countryside.

Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Architecture, Building and Structure Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Fran Parente

Al Ghunayman Villa Architecture by Islam Farrag

This ultra-modern villa with its fluid architecture, seamlessly integrates with nature, featuring expansive glass walls and minimalist interiors, while organic shapes and a subdued color palette evoke a sense of tranquility and sophistication.

Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Architecture, Building and Structure Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Islam Farrag

Embrasse Moi Lamp Sculpture Lamp by Giuseppe Tortato

Embrasse Moi is a piece of art designed with parametric software and handcrafted, maintaining a unique and sinuous design. The inspiration comes from the spirals of DNA and the possibility, through craftsmanship, to bend a difficult material like bronze.

Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Lighting Products and Fixtures Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Carola Merello

Xingshufu Banouet Restaurant by Haodong Liu

The Xingshufu Banouet Restaurant is a high-end dining space that mainly integrates Sichuan cuisine, and features materials like wood veneer, vintage stainless steel, marble, leather, mirrored stainless steel, mosaic, Malay paint, and more.

Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Interior Space and Exhibition Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Haha Lu

Huai’an Zhongshuge Bookstore by Li Xiang

The design of Huai’an Zhongshuge draws inspiration from the local urban culture, the theme of human exploration of the universe, and the symbolic significance of books.

Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Interior Space and Exhibition Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by SFAP

Chicago Line Armchair by Alexandre Kasper

The “Chicago” collection is inspired by the essence of modern and industrial architecture that defines the city of Chicago, in the United States.

Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Furniture Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Alexandre Kasper

Snow Park Exhibition Center by Kris Lin

The inspiration for this project comes from a documentary about a Chinese explorer’s glacier expedition. The exhibition hall features a fluid circulation design and multi-sensory interactive installations that seamlessly immerse visitors.

Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Interior Space and Exhibition Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Kris Lin International Design

Mystical Serpent Light Art Installation by PHAIdesign

The inspiration of “Mystical Serpent” comes from the legend of Zhulong, a serpent deity from ancient Chinese lore who governs day-night cycles and symbolizes eternal life.

Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Fine Arts and Art Installation Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by DXIN

Spiral Bloom Public Art by Kuo Kuo-Hsiang

The artwork Spiral Bloom is inspired by the dynamic energy of life and the infinite possibilities of the future. The design draws from natural forms in motion, such as the spiraling patterns found in biological growth, celestial bodies, and fluid dynamics.

Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Fine Arts and Art Installation Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Kuo Kuo-Hsiang

Hug Me Sitting by Zipeng Zhou

The naturally extending arm design, inspired by a warm embrace, carries two layers of meaning: It imbues the “hug me” with deep affection and the warmth of love.

Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Furniture Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Zipeng Zhou

Trustlucent Connected Dining Table by Sadra Boushehri Design Studio

The journey of this dining table began with a client’s request not to cover the window with furniture. Light moves freely beneath it, creating an airy feel, while the soft oak veneer is warm to the touch, and the nearly invisible base enhances the floating illusion.

Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Kitchen Furniture, Equipment and Fixtures Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Sadra Boushehri Design Studio

Color Roller Furniture Set by Chuheng He

Color Roller is a furniture set that changes color combinations through rolling, using basic shapes and colors to create a unique spatial experience. Made from transparent acrylic, it displays varied colors under different lighting.

Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Furniture Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Chuheng He

Tresound Mini Desktop Bluetooth Speaker by Yong Cao and Jianfeng Lv

With its minimalist appearance and operation, Tresound is a Bluetooth speaker with its mountain shape appearance conforming to the principles of speaker acoustics, with high peaks (high pitched) and thick valleys (mid to low pitched).

Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Audio and Sound Equipment Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by TRETTITRE

AI Vision Sofa by Yunxiang Zou

The design of this product draws inspiration from the aesthetic form of AI glasses, boasting not only remarkable advantages in aesthetics but also delivering unique practical value.

Golden A’ Design Award Winner for Furniture Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Yunxiang Zou

Mia Foldable Cat Bag by Yu Ren

FurBallRetreat creates the perfect resting space for your cat! It not only has a beautiful and lovely book-like appearance but also is an essential tool for you and your cat to explore the outdoor world together.

Silver A’ Design Award Winner for Pet Care, Toys, Supplies and Products for Animals Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Yu Ren

Secret Of Eternity Necklace And Brooch by Esra Erciyes

This jewelry piece is inspired by the infinite life cycle of Turritopsis Dohrnii, a species of jellyfish capable of reverting from the adult medusa stage to the polyp stage, making it biologically immortal. The rotating curves symbolize infinite life, while the LED lights represent energy and purity.

Platinum A’ Design Award Winner for Jewelry Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by Company Truva Visual Arts, Art Director /Cüneyt Aslan,Edited / Aysenur Sentürk

Lighting Panels Wooden Interior Decoration by Form at Wood

The Lighting Panel was inspired by the natural beauty of wood and the atmospheric potential of integrated lighting.

Silver A’ Design Award Winner for Luxury Design Category – find out more here.
Photography by FORM AT WOOD

To be part of the A’ Design Award and Competition, register your designs – here

contemporist has partnered with A’ Design Award and Competition to bring you this editorial feature
